intro: Inversodicraea mangorensis, commonly known as the Mangorensis tree, is a rare and endemic species native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and aromatic properties. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct glossy appearance. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
